Abstract:
The MODIS/Terra V5 LST/E Monthly L3 Global CMG product (Short name: MOD11C3) is a monthly composited average, derived from the MOD11C1 daily global product, and stored as clear-sky LST values during a month’s period in a 0.05º (5600 meters) geographic CMG. MOD11C3, therefore, inherits all the structural features of its MOD11C1 parent except for the temporal configuration. Please refer to the MOD11C1 product documentation for all algorithm-related details.

The V5 MOD11C3 product comprises the following Science Data Set (SDS) layers for daytime and nighttime observations: LSTs, quality control assessments, observation times, view zenith angles, clear sky coverages, and emissivities for bands 20, 22, 23, 29, 31, and 32.

The V5 Terra/MODIS LST/E products, including MOD11C3, are validated to Stage-2 through field campaigns and radiance-based validation studies. Further details regarding MODIS land product validation for the LST/E products are available from the following URL: http://landval.gsfc.nasa.gov/ProductStatus.php?ProductID=MOD11

This product is ready for use in science applications/publications.

The V5 MOD11C3 products have a temporal acquisition range, which starts March 1, 2000 (2000-065), and continued through March 31, 2017. The V5 collection is not consistent with V4 and V41, and users should exercise caution as they plan to use the different collections.

V005 Data Set Characteristics: 
Temporal Coverage: V005 March 1, 2000 – March 31, 2017
Area: Global 
Size: 3600 x 7200 rows/columns 
Resolution: 0.05 degrees (5600 meters at the Equator) 
File Size: ~80 MB compressed
Projection: Geographic (Lat/Lon grid)
Data Format: HDF-EOS 
Science Data Sets (SDS HDF Layers): 17

RelatedUrls.Description: Data set landing page at the LP DAAC
Interface to search, discover, and access EOS data products, and invoke available data services.
LP DAAC Data Pool provides direct access to all currently available MODIS products and the ability to download them via HTTP.

USGS EarthExplorer (EE) provides users the ability to query, search and order archived ASTER and MODIS products available from the LP DAAC.  Registered users of EE have access to additional features than guest users.
Refine your granule search with ECHO's next generation Earth Science discovery tool (Reverb) using information from this record.

The Land Processes Distributed Active Archive Center (LP DAAC) is one of several discipline-specific data centers within the NASA Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS).  The LP DAAC Web page provides information about available data products, services, documentation, order interfaces, and tools.
The MODIS Land home page is maintained through NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center and documents various aspects of the land component of the MODIS mission.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTGOODQUALITY
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Percent of pixels with good quality

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTNOTPRODUCEDOTHER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Percent of pixels not produced due to some reason other than cloud

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTOTHERQUALITY
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Percent of pixels with not so good quality

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSVERSION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Version of the process software that generated the product.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CLOUD_CONTAMINATED_LST_SCREENED
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Indicator of whether cloud-contaminated Land Surface Temperature values are screened off.

EntryTitle: MODIS/Terra Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Monthly L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V005
